news.title: Harare Braces for Mega 8 Festival : Nigerian Gospel Heavyweights Minister GUC, Ebuka Songs Set To Arrive In Country…
news.content:
By A Correspondent

Nigerian gospel artists, Minister GUC and Ebuka are set to jet into the country tomorrow ahead of the Mega 8 All Night Prayer Festival set for Glamis Arena in Harare on Friday night.

The top Nigerian gospel icons will perform alongside local artists Takesure Zamar and Dorcas Moyo at a colourful event expected to feature both local and international preachers.

Daughters of Virtue, the organisers of the high-profile gathering, confirmed the development yesterday.

We are ready for the 8th edition of Mega 8. Preparations are underway at Glamis Arena at Harare Showgrounds. It has been confirmed and reconfirmed that Ebuka Songs will be here, and GUC will be landing on Thursday, Daughters of Virtue said in an audio confirmation.

Minister GUC  real name Gift Ugochi Christopher  was born on October 8, 1993. The 32-year-old Nigerian singer, musician and songwriter rose to fame after the release of his first album in December 2020, which featured hits such asAll That Matters,DesperateandYours.

Ebuka Songs  real name Ebuka Emmanuel Hillary  was born on May 10, 1992. He became a household name in gospel music with his breakthrough singleI Will Pray.

Locally, award-winning gospel sensation Dorcas Moyo, known for hits likeTirikutandaraandNdipeiwo Mukana, will also grace the stage. Minister Takesure Zamar, a legend in Zimbabwes gospel industry, will lead worship alongside the Nigerian stars.

The highly anticipated all-night prayer is expected to draw a record-breaking crowd.

We usually attract around 30,000 congregants, but this year we are expecting over 35,000 because of the musicians on the line-up, said Daughters of Virtue.

Daughters of Virtue is a prayer group registered with the Evangelical Fellowship of Zimbabwe (EFZ).
news.description:
By A Correspondent Nigerian gospel artists, Minister GUC and Ebuka are set to jet into the country tomorrow ahead of …

Continue reading "Harare Braces for Mega 8 Festival : Nigerian Gospel Heavyweights Minister GUC, Ebuka Songs Set To Arrive In Country…"

news.title: Lawyers demand release of NetOne ceo, slam ZACC over “unlawful arrest”
news.content:
By A Correspondent|  Lawyers representing NetOne Cellular (Pvt) Ltd Chief Executive Officer, Raphael Mushanawani, have accused the Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission (ZACC) of unlawful conduct, arguing that their clients arrest stemmed from investigators misunderstanding of the mobile operators IT systems.

Mushanawani was taken into custody on Monday on allegations of fraud involving more than US$1.2 million.

According to ZACC, the CEO allegedly contracted Lunartech Solutions (Pvt) Ltd without board approval to upgrade NetOnes SAGE 1000 system for US$257,600, despite an ongoing US$3.5 million project with Farevic Systems (Pvt) Ltd to implement a new SAP ERP platform.

He is further accused of signing unauthorized addendums that inflated the SAGE project cost to US$1.2 million and awarding a separate US$79,467 contract to Diztech (Pvt) Ltd.

In a strongly-worded letter dated September 30 and addressed to ZACCs General Manager of Investigations, Mushanawanis lawyers, Rubaya and Chatambudza Legal Practitioners, demanded his urgent unconditional release, describing his detention as unlawful and baseless.

Our client is at a loss as to why he finds himself languishing in police custody over an issue which exposes your officers lack of understanding of IT systems, the lawyers wrote.

They argued that investigators had failed to distinguish between NetOnes IT platforms, insisting the SAGE 1000 upgrade was unrelated to the SAP ERP rollout.

It should have been clear to your officers that the SAP Enterprise Resource Planning System  is totally different from the SAGE 1000 or SAGE L200, the lawyers said.

The defence further noted that NetOne had no choice but to upgrade after SAGE South Africa advised it would cease supporting the SAGE ERP 1000 after 31 December 2024, warning that continued reliance on the outdated system would expose the company to operational risks.

ZACC, however, insists that Mushanawani acted outside governance procedures, entering into unauthorized contracts that prejudiced the state-owned mobile operator.
news.description:
By A Correspondent| Lawyers representing NetOne Cellular (Pvt) Ltd Chief Executive Officer, Raphael Mushanawani, have accused the Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission …

Continue reading "Lawyers demand release of NetOne ceo, slam ZACC over “unlawful arrest”"

news.title: Magaya Properties Auctioned
news.content:
By A Correspondent  Controversial preacher Prophet Walter Magaya, founder of the Prophetic Healing and Deliverance (PHD) Ministries, has lost control of his multimillion-dollar hotel and stadium complex in Harare after the High Court issued a writ of execution.

According to court records (Case Number SH3294/25), Chinese national Li Xiu Yun successfully obtained the order for the sale in execution of Magayas rights and title to Stand 168 of Prospect, a 3.84-hectare property situated along Smuts Road in Waterfalls, Harare.

The property, once touted as a flagship investment by Magayas ministry, houses a four-star-standard hotel, several cluster houses and lodges, and a modern football stadium. The facilities turned the Prospect area into a hub of activity, hosting football matches, church events, and attracting local and international visitors.

The impending auction marks one of the biggest financial and legal blows to Magayas empire, which has grown over the past decade through a combination of religious influence, business ventures, and real estate acquisitions.

Since founding PHD Ministries in 2012, Magaya aggressively expanded into property and hospitality. His hotel in Waterfalls was marketed as a premium accommodation centre, catering not only to church pilgrims but also to business travellers and sports tourists.

The stadiumone of the largest privately built sports facilities in Hararewas particularly significant. It became a venue for football and community events, often doubling as a stage for his mega-church gatherings that drew tens of thousands of congregants.

Magaya also invested in residential estates, commercial centres, and health facilities, framing his ventures as part of a broader vision to empower communities through employment creation and infrastructure development.

However, many of these projects were marred by controversy. Some collapsed midway due to financial difficulties, while others were tied to lawsuits involving unpaid contractors, disgruntled investors, and foreign partners who accused Magaya of breach of contract.

President Emmerson Mnangagwa personally commissioned Magayas Yadah Stadium in Waterfalls, hailing it as a model of private investment that could complement government efforts to revive Zimbabwes ailing infrastructure. The event symbolised the close ties Magaya had cultivated with the political establishment, projecting him not only as a spiritual leader but also as an influential player in the countrys economic landscape.

At the commissioning, Mnangagwa praised Magayas vision and urged other church leaders and businesspeople to emulate him in supporting national development. The endorsement cemented Magayas reputation as a politically connected clergyman whose projects carried the weight of state approval.

Yet, despite such high-profile backing, cracks soon appeared in his empire. Allegations of financial mismanagement, debts owed to foreign investors, and legal disputes increasingly dogged his ventures.

The latest High Court ruling is tied to Magayas dispute with Li Xiu Yun, a Chinese investor who is owed substantial sums. The writ of execution authorises the sale of PHD Ministries rights and title to the hotel, stadium, and associated properties to recover the debt.

For the thousands of PHD congregants who regarded the Waterfalls complex as the heart of their ministry, the looming auction represents not only the loss of a spiritual home but also the collapse of one of Zimbabwes most ambitious religious property projects.

For Magaya himself, the ruling is a humiliating reversal from the days when he shared a stage with the President to celebrate his business vision.
news.description:
By A Correspondent – Controversial preacher Prophet Walter Magaya, founder of the Prophetic Healing and Deliverance (PHD) Ministries, has lost …

Continue reading "Magaya Properties Auctioned"

news.title: Dynamos Legend Dies
news.content:
By Sports Reporter- Former Dynamos captain and Warriors right-back Angirayi Chapo has died.

Chapo passed away on Tuesday at his home in Mufakose.

Known affectionately as The Durawall, Chapo was admired for his fearless, no-nonsense defending and his unwavering commitment on the pitch.

His presence in the Dynamos backline, alongside goalkeeper Peter Fanuel, centre-backs Francis Shonhayi and Henry Chari, and the versatile Stanley Chirambadare, made the team a formidable force that opponents feared.

Chapo also wore the national colours with pride, playing a key role in the Warriors near miss for the 1992 Africa Cup of Nations after a heartbreaking 2-2 draw against Congo Brazzaville in 1991.

He began his journey with Dynamos in 1984, guided by former Glamour Boys midfielder Clayton Munemo, and quickly rose to captaincy.

His tough tackling, combined with incisive overlapping runs, left an indelible mark on Zimbabwean football and inspired countless young players.

Chapo was part of a celebrated generation of Mufakose footballers, including Munemo, former captain Memory Mucherahohwa, Simon Chuma, the late Gift Mpariwa, and Taurai and Nyaro Mangwiro, whose talent and determination helped shape the legacy of Dynamos.
news.description:
By Sports Reporter- Former Dynamos captain and Warriors right-back Angirayi Chapo has died. Chapo passed away on Tuesday at his …

news.title: Magaya Top Aide in Violent Physical Fight
news.content:
By Sports Reporter Yadah FCs reputation as the church boys of the Premier Soccer League has been badly dented after a shocking violent outburst involving one of their top officials. Spencer Muvadi, a senior executive at the Prophet Walter Magaya-owned club, was fined US$4 000 and banned from football for a year after assaulting the teams goalkeeper, Goodknows Gurure.

The incident, which unfolded in full view at Yadahs Heart Stadium on August 22 after a clash with Ngezi Platinum, has left the Miracle Boys nursing more than just bruised pride.

PSL communications officer Kudzai Bare confirmed the disciplinary action: Mr. Muvadi was found guilty of breaching the PSL Rules and Regulations and the Committee has imposed a fine of US$4 000 together with costs of the hearing.

As part of the punishment, Muvadi has also been barred from conducting any football business on behalf of Yadah or any other PSL club, and is prohibited from attending league matches for the next 12 months.

The club itself was not spared. Yadah FC were slapped with a US$5 000 fine for failing to control their official, with just 15 days to settle the penalty.

In a stern warning, the PSL reminded clubs of their responsibility to safeguard the spirit of the game: The League remains committed to upholding discipline, protecting the integrity of the game and promoting a safe environment for all participants.

For a team that prides itself on its spiritual branding, the scandal is a heavy blow. The Miracle Boys, once celebrated for combining faith with football, now find themselves praying for redemption as their anointed image continues to take serious knocks.
news.description:
By Sports Reporter – Yadah FC’s reputation as the “church boys” of the Premier Soccer League has been badly dented after …

Continue reading "Magaya Top Aide in Violent Physical Fight"

news.title: VP Chiwenga, Mnangagwa Fight Gets Ugly
news.content:
By A Correspondent The simmering power struggles between President Emmerson Mnangagwa and his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga, have now spilled into open confrontation, with their feud escalating dramatically ahead of Zanu PFs 22nd Annual Peoples Conference in Mutare. What began as whispers of factional manoeuvres has turned into an ugly public fight, shaking the ruling partys top ranks and exposing the fragile balance of power within its leadership.

The latest flashpoint came at Mondays Policy and Coordinating Meeting, chaired by newly appointed Secretary General Jacob Mudenda. While the party issued a bland statement that only spoke of internal administrative issues and preparations for the conference, insiders dismissed the communique as camouflage for a calculated attempt by Mnangagwa to sideline Chiwenga.

Everyone knows Mudenda is a pawn. He has no power of his own, said one official aligned to the military faction. This is about clipping Chiwengas wings before Mutare. But they cant erase his influence.

Mudenda, who replaced Obert Mpofu, is widely regarded as a weak link, imposed to rubber-stamp Mnangagwas agenda. Chiwengas loyalists argue that the secretary-generals office has been reduced to a weapon in the succession struggle, with Mnangagwa propping up figures like Mudenda and the so-calledZvigananda wealthy businessmen accused of bankrolling his presidency.

The tensions boiled over in dramatic fashion last week when Mnangagwa and Chiwenga clashed at State House, an altercation that nearly turned physical. For a military man like Chiwenga, openly confronting his commander-in-chief was no minor act  it was a calculated political strike.

At the heart of the dispute lies a dossier Chiwenga presented, accusing Mnangagwas allies  including Kudakwashe Tagwirei, Wicknell Chivayo, Pedzisayi Scott Sakupwanya, and Delish Nguwaya  of industrial-scale looting. His warning was blunt: When Chivayo gives you ten million dollars, he has already taken ninety million. The attack was not just on corruption but on the financial networks that sustain Mnangagwas hold on power.

Mnangagwa responded with fury, defending his allies and even calling Nguwaya my friend, before storming out and moving swiftly to consolidate control. Within days, he reshuffled the politburo, elevating loyalists and tightening his grip on party structures.

The propaganda machine was also unleashed. Presidential adviser Christopher Mutsvangwa dismissed Chiwengas allegations as jealousy, declaring: He is not the only one who fought in the liberation war. But Chiwenga doubled down, invoking the spectre of the 1974 Nhari Rebellion to warn that unchecked factionalism could destroy the party from within.

The symbolism of the showdown is stark. For the first time since they ousted Robert Mugabe in 2017, Mnangagwa and Chiwenga are no longer allies but adversaries. The stakes are existential  not only for the two men but for Zanu PF itself.

As one politburo insider put it: It feels like 2017 all over again. Only this time, the generals are turning against each other.

All eyes now turn to Mutare. If last weeks near-brawl was the dress rehearsal, Octobers conference could be the stage for the main act in Mnangagwa and Chiwengas increasingly ugly fight for supremacy.
news.description:
By A Correspondent – The simmering power struggles between President Emmerson Mnangagwa and his deputy, Constantino Chiwenga, have now spilled into …

Continue reading "VP Chiwenga, Mnangagwa Fight Gets Ugly"

news.title: Chiwenga Supporters Reject Mnangagwa’s “Token Secretary General”
news.content:
By A Correspondent

HARARE  Fierce criticism has erupted within Zanu PF as allies of Vice President Constantino Chiwenga dismissed Jacob Mudendas authority as Secretary General, branding him nothing more than a token appointee installed by President Emmerson Mnangagwa to weaken his deputy.

Zanu PF on Monday tried to present a united front after its Policy and Coordinating Meeting, releasing a statement that read: The ZANU PF Policy and Coordinating Meeting was held on Monday at ZANU PF Headquarters, chaired by the Secretary General Advocate Jacob Mudenda. The key highlights were internal administrative issues discussions and deliberations on the state of preparedness on the upcoming 22nd Annual Peoples Conference in Mutare.

But the official statement was immediately undermined by sharp criticism from Chiwenga loyalists. Mudenda is not running the party. He is simply a figure in the chair, put there to undermine the Vice President. Everyone in Zanu PF knows this, said one senior official aligned to the military faction.

Mudenda replaced Obert Mpofu in what insiders describe as a direct move by Mnangagwa and his allies, including Zvigananda, to chip away at Chiwengas influence. The Secretary Generals post has been turned into a weapon of factional politics. Mudenda is a token, not a leader. Chiwengas influence cannot be erased by reshuffling offices, fumed another official.

Analysts warn the strategy could boomerang. You cannot erase the man who fronted the 2017 military intervention that brought this regime to power. Mudenda has no grassroots support, and his role is merely symbolic. This exposes the fractures in Zanu PFs leadership, one commentator observed.

As preparations continue for the partys 22nd Annual Peoples Conference in Mutare, Zanu PF faces growing disunity. Mnangagwas attempts to clip Chiwengas wings through Mudendas appointment may instead deepen the fault lines threatening to tear the party apart from within.
news.description:
By A Correspondent HARARE – Fierce criticism has erupted within Zanu PF as allies of Vice President Constantino Chiwenga dismissed …

Continue reading "Chiwenga Supporters Reject Mnangagwa’s “Token Secretary General”"

news.title: Gen Chiwenga Sympathisers Insist Mudenda Is Not In Charge…
news.content:
By A Correspondent

HARARE  Zanu PFs attempt to project order at its Monday Policy and Coordinating Meeting has backfired, with critics and party insiders dismissing Jacob Mudendas authority as Secretary General, accusing President Emmerson Mnangagwa of using him as a pawn in the fight against Vice President Constantino Chiwenga.

The ruling party issued a bland statement saying: The ZANU PF Policy and Coordinating Meeting was held on Monday at ZANU PF Headquarters, chaired by the Secretary General Advocate Jacob Mudenda. The key highlights were internal administrative issues discussions and deliberations on the state of preparedness on the upcoming 22nd Annual Peoples Conference in Mutare.

But insiders and Chiwenga loyalists were quick to rubbish the narrative, insisting Mudenda is a figurehead with no real control. Mudenda is only occupying an office; he is not in charge of anything. Everyone knows this was a calculated move to clip Chiwengas wings, said one senior official aligned to the military faction.

Mudenda, who replaced Obert Mpofu as Secretary General, is seen by many as a weak choice imposed to satisfy Mnangagwas agenda of sidelining rivals. Another Chiwenga supporter fumed: The Secretary Generals chair is now a weapon, not a post. Mnangagwa and his allies like Zvigananda are playing politics of survival, but they cannot erase Chiwengas influence in the party.

The simmering tension highlights deepening cracks in Zanu PFs top ranks ahead of the partys 22nd National Peoples Conference in Mutare. Analysts say the attempt to neutralize Chiwenga is likely to backfire. You cannot wish away a man who led a military intervention that brought this government into power. Mudenda has no political base; he is simply there to read statements, noted a political commentator.

As the conference draws closer, the battle lines are clearer than ever: Mnangagwas camp pushing Mudenda as the face of administration, while Chiwengas sympathisers insist the real fight for power is only just beginning.
news.description:
By A Correspondent HARARE – Zanu PF’s attempt to project order at its Monday Policy and Coordinating Meeting has backfired, …

Continue reading "Gen Chiwenga Sympathisers Insist Mudenda Is Not In Charge…"
